author: Jeff Geerling
description:
Mini NASes are coming out at a rapid pace. Do any of them have the right balance between IO, power, and noise to fit in my mini homelab?

Mentioned in this video (some links are affiliate links):

  - Aiffro K100: https://www.aiffro.com/products/all-ssd-nas-k100
  - Beelink ME mini: https://amzn.to/4lvu6Zv
  - GMKtec G9: https://amzn.to/3Tb9Kso

Equipment I used for testing / measurement:

  - Kingspec NX 2TB NVMe SSD: https://amzn.to/46e83BW
  - ThirdReality Zigbee Smart Outlet: https://amzn.to/4emI25t
  - Reed Instruments R8050 Sound Level Meter: https://amzn.to/4nmHsZB

Support me on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/geerlingguy
Sponsor me on GitHub: https://github.com/sponsors/geerlingguy
Merch: https://www.redshirtjeff.com
2nd Channel: https://www.youtube.com/@GeerlingEngineering
3rd Channel: https://www.youtube.com/@Level2Jeff

Contents:

00:00 - Three mini NASes
00:50 - Fast NVMes and a hot G9
01:22 - Aiffro K100
03:12 - K100 BIOS, performance, thermals
04:39 - Beelink and insid
title: The Mini NAS has arrived! (mini homelab)
